channel.title: EN on Hungarian Psycho
channel.description: Recent content in EN on Hungarian Psycho

item.title: Ode to Algocracy
item.description: Town square beheadings, powdered wigs and democratic elections – although currently regarded as one of the sacred axioms of modern democracy, the popular vote might ultimately end up in the same bucket as any other obsolete, bizarre or cruel tradition we used to believe was the pinnacle of our civilization. Are two (or multiple) heads really better than one? Does this mythical entity that periodically emerges from us, voters – a collective-unconscious hydra of sorts – really know what’s best?
